tag_list: entrepreneur, online-technology, web-development, branding, strategy, writing, design, marketing
overview:
Clinton is a Canadian online brand strategist and entrepreneur. He works with a number of firms in North America and, in the past, has worked with 50+ clients build their websites and brands online.

Clinton believes social media and the mobile web are two critical aspects brands need to focus on in order to fully maximize their online presence. He’s currently working on developing a mobile CMS to help businesses create better, more engaging mobile websites.

The majority of Clinton’s experience centers around design, application development, writing for the web, search engine optimization and social media. He is very active on Twitter and writes a number of tech and branding related blogs.

In 2008, Clinton wrote a PHP framework called BlackLeopardEngine. This later became the platform for which he built PutFeed.com in 2009, a twitter-like application for businesses, which gained a small following.

In 2011, Clinton launched Rent2Bike.com, an online service that helps cyclists find and book bike rentals, which made 200+ bike shop registrations.

This year, he launched StartupPipe.com, CriticFeed.com and Seesawr.com, three experimental prototypes geared towards large audiences.

This October, he announced PHPFormBaby for building faster HTML5 forms.

Clinton also contributes to the HTMLKickstart Blog occasionally and the Unofficial ProcessWire Docs.
